data.name: Buggy docx
data.discription: Oh, this buggy docx again, something broke again. How does it differ from the usual stable txt format at all?
data.author: yosum

data.name: Walk
data.discription: During the walk, you can find many interesting things. And they are not always what they seem at first (non-binary) glance.
data.author: yosum

data.name: Sonic
data.discription: Doctor Ivo 'Eggman' Robotnik wants to take over the world again. *BOOM* What? End of the game? Already? Only SonicVisu the Hedgehog and his team can handle this.
data.author: yosum

data.name: Color blind Test
data.discription: For a special mission, our research team is looking for people who can see in a non-standard color plane, maybe you are one of them?
data.author: yosum

data.name: Mail
data.discription: That right there is the mail. Now let's talk about the mail. Can we talk about the mail please, Yos? I've been dying to talk about the mail with you all day, okay? John the Ripper, this name keeps comin' up over and over and over again. Every day John's mail's getting sent back to me. John the Ripper, John the Ripper, I look in the mail, this whole box is John the Ripper! So I say to myself I gotta find this guy. I gotta go up to his office, I gotta put his mail in the guy's goddamn hands! Otherwise he's never gonna get it, it's gonna keep coming back down here. Note: Adjust the flag to match the usual 4hsl33p{...}
data.author: yosum

data.name: Rome Emperor
data.discription: I found this strange message, it seems to me there is nothing interesting in it, but does Julius Caesar think so?
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: brrr64
data.discription: I have the cyphertext, the filename is brrr64. I tried to decrypt it and I said brrr 64 times, but it doesn't help. May be you can decrypt it?
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: OCTOpus v8
data.discription: Without many words. Come on, solve!
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: brrr16
data.discription: Again??? I said brrr 16 times, but it's not giving me a flag. I'm not comfortable asking you to help me again :(
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: FBI Agent
data.discription: We learned that one of the secret agents of the US State Department, a leading programmer, was undercover and sent to Russia in order to find out the plans of a cunning weapon that could make Putin immortal. We do not know what the agent looks like, what he enjoys, we only know the name and surname - Anna Shtirman. We learned that in order to contact a mole in the Russian Federation, an agent registered on a site where programmers like him are sitting and posted there a secret code that only a mole can understand. Your task is to get ahead of the mole and be the first to find out the secret phrase.
data.author: mr_k3k

data.name: Et tu, Brute?
data.discription: One not little-known Roman emperor once long ago invented a feature that made it possible to hide the content of a message if it was intercepted by enemies. We intercepted one such message and are 100% sure that it contains a flag. Help me please.
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: XORoshiy MAN
data.discription: While the person who was walking to the water was telling us about his knowledge, someone intercepted this strange message, did not understand anything, but realized that you need to look xorosho, preferably with the key 1337. Good luck!
data.author: funcN4me

data.name: Matry0shka
data.discription: Matryoshka is a Russian wooden toy in the form of a painted doll, inside which there are smaller dolls like it. The number of nested dolls is usually three or more ... What am I talking about? There is no time to deal with this nonsense, to horse! We have a corpse. Perhaps a crime!

data.name: Endians
data.discription: Employees of the secret laboratory are sure that something is hidden in the audio file, but for some reason the studies were closed, all the test-subjects specialists had already given up, suffering from a terrible headache. As it turned out, the cost of a mistake is life (ability to hear). However, an annex to the file was recently discovered, perhaps at least it will bring some clarity. Note: Adjust the flag to match the usual 4hsl33p{...}

data.name: BAD STUDENT!!!
data.discription: The dean's office of the GUMRF asked us to calculate the place where one of the students who drinks while studying. Teachers several times complained about a student who always came to couples drunk, but instead of a name, they indicated only his nickname in some social network! But to enter it you need an account, unfortunately. Yes, this student's login looks like this loliminvisibl9048. The flag to the task looks like this: 4hsl33p{x.???_y.???} (first three numbers, don't round up!)
data.author: mr_k3k

data.name: Hash v2
data.discription:
>>> salt = 'eW91IGFyZSBjdXJpb3Vz'
>>> print(hashlib.md5((salt + password).encode('ascii')).hexdigest())
9ec57a05ea84559b5c32907f11deba9b
>>> flag = '4hsl33p{' + password + '}'
data.author: yosum

data.name: Mort
data.discription:
John hid the flag! Again! But this time rockyou.txt doesn't break it. It is known that John's favorite book is 'Mort' by Terry Pratchett, and he reads it only in the original.
Note: the password for the archive is one word without special characters!
data.author: yosum
